channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Your Company Can Retain Talent as Child Care Costs Drive Women Out of the Workforce
item.description: Rising daycare costs are driving half the working population off the job because they aren’t making enough to cover those costs.

item.title: DeepSeek’s new model sees text differently, opening new possibilities for enterprise AI
item.description: Chinese AI company DeepSeek may have found a way to help large language models see more, remember more, and cost less.

item.title: The Fed just lost a key data feed on the job market days before its next rate meeting — a former BLS chief warns it’s “very concerning” as Powell is left “flying blind”
item.description: A once-obscure data-sharing deal between ADP and the Fed helped shape monetary policy for years—until it abruptly vanished.

item.title: Crypto M&A surges 30-fold as niche firms shift to mainstream
item.description: Crypto M&A topped $10 billion for the first time in the third quarter, a more than 30-fold increase from a year earlier, according to Architect Partne...

item.title: To Increase Your Company’s Productivity, Make Sure Everyone Eats Lunch
item.description: Workers are increasingly skipping noon meals because of inflation and guilt about taking breaks.

item.title: Tech and media layoffs October 2025: Rivian, Meta, Paycom, NBC News, and more cut jobs this fall
item.description: Electric-truck maker Rivian is laying off another 600 people, or about 4% of its workforce as the global demand for electric vehicles decreases, the W...

item.title: Trump pardons Binance founder Changpeng Zhao 2 years after the crypto billionaire’s guilty plea
item.description: The Binance founder pleaded guilty in 2023 to failing to maintain an effective anti-money-laundering regime.

item.title: Inside the mob-backed gambling ring that just shook the NBA
item.description: The FBI dropped a bombshell indictment on Thursday, announcing arrests and criminal charges against dozens of people allegedly involved with gambling ...

item.title: Tesla posts weak earnings again, and the ‘Musk Magic’ Premium shows its shares are way overpriced
item.description: By Fortune's calculations, investors' belief in Elon Musk's vision accounts for 90% of market value—a whopping $1.35 trillion.

item.title: COVID vaccines show an unexpected benefit: helping fight cancer
item.description: Personalized vaccines that steer the immune system to fight unique cancer cells show promise, but another powerful way to treat cancer might be hiding...

item.title: Think late-night TV is controversial now? Wait until you hear what happened in the 1970s
item.description: Late-night talk shows are a uniquely American invention that blend humor, the news of the day, and celebrity guests. While Johnny Carson was not the f...

item.title: Jay Shetty Expands His Tea Brand Juni Into Whole Foods Stores Nationwide
item.description: The hit podcaster says his company is on track to end 2025 with 300 percent growth and eight figures in revenue.

item.title: Reddit Sued Perplexity for Data Scraping—and Compared the Startup to a ‘North Korean Hacker’
item.description: In a scathing filing, Reddit called Perplexity a “willing customer” of an illegal “data laundering” economy.

item.title: Donald Trump Just Pardoned the Founder of Binance
item.description: Changpeng Zhao, founder of the crypto exchange, had been convicted of federal anti money-laundering violations.

item.title: Tesla recalls over 63,000 Cybertrucks due to the front lights being too bright
item.description: Tesla is recalling more than 63,000 Cybertrucks in the U.S. because the front lights are too bright, which may cause a distraction to other drivers an...
